title: Provost-Marshal: a romance of the middle shires

snippet: Sir William Cranstoun was Captain or Provost- Marshal of his Majesty's Guard on the Scottish side of the Border. This was not Lord Scone's Guard, which had Edinburgh for its headquarters, and which had eight years before arrested Robin Maxwell near Cramond Brig, but a special body of horse raised for the purpose of pacifying the Borders. Sir William was a tall soldier-like man of middle age.
